channel.title: FunPK [PI]
channel.description: Looked all over, could not find a good guide, could anyone link me to a working tutorial on FunPK for 317 [PI]

item.title: FunPK [PI]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Okay, lets try this again:
Here is what it looks like to make the error you did:

[code=java]
public void someMethod(){//Firt open
if(someShit = true){//Second open
doMoreShit();
}//Second close (The close to the if statement, hence why I said second not first)
else
System.out.println(“You can’t do this shit!”);

public boolean inFunPk(){//Third Open (Start of inFunPk)
if(absX > 0 && absX < 100 && absY > 0 && absY < 100) {//Fourth Open
return true;
}//Fourth Close, end of if statement
return false;
}//Third close, end of inFunPk

}//First Close (end of the someMethod() )[/code]

And here is what it looks like (same exact code) with no error (besides it being demo code and not real):

[code=java]
public void someMethod(){//Firt open
if(someShit = true){//Second open
doMoreShit();
}//Second close (The close to the if statement, hence why I said second not first)
else
System.out.println(“You can’t do this shit!”);
}//First Close (end of the someMethod() )

public boolean inFunPk(){//Third Open (Start of inFunPk)
if(absX > 0 && absX < 100 && absY > 0 && absY < 100) {//Fourth Open
return true;
}//Fourth Close, end of if statement
return false;
}//Third close, end of inFunPk[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: FunPK [PI]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

You put the boolean inside another method…

Example:

public void someMethod(){ if(player.HasRights){ c.sendMessage("Yolo"); } public boolean inFunPk(){//Your Error... if(absX > 0 && absX < 100 && absY > 0 && absY < 100) { return true; } return false; } }

I hope that makes sense to you, it does to me.

Read full topic

item.title: FunPK [PI]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Just make a normal pk zone.
And get the box coords (like you would make for a normal pk zone) and make it into a boolean (again, just like a normal pk zone). Then in the apply dead, where you lose all your stuff, just use an if statement.

Ex:

public boolean inFunPK(){ if(absX > 0 && absX < 100 && absY > 0 && absY < 100) { return true; } return false; }
I hope you can do the rest.

Read full topic
